semantic_title: Format and Structure of ICD-10-CM Codes: Categories, Subcategories, and Character Requirements
section_path: Section I > A. Conventions > 2. Format and Structure

content.full_text: The ICD-10-CM Tabular List contains categories, subcategories and codes. Characters for categories, subcategories and codes may be either a letter or a number. All categories are 3 characters. A three-character category that has no further subdivision is equivalent to a code. Subcategories are either 4 or 5 characters. Codes may be 3, 4, 5, 6 or 7 characters. That is, each level of subdivision after a category is a subcategory. The final level of subdivision is a code. Codes that have applicable 7th characters are still referred to as codes, not subcategories. A code that has an applicable 7th character is considered invalid without the 7th character. The ICD-10-CM uses an indented format for ease in reference. (Evidence: pg no: 7-8, L18-L23)
content.summary: Defines the hierarchical structure of ICD-10-CM with specific character requirements for categories, subcategories, and codes (Evidence: pg no: 7-8, L18-L23)
key_concepts: Categories are always 3 characters (Evidence: pg no: 7, L19)
Subcategories are 4 or 5 characters (Evidence: pg no: 7, L19)
Codes may be 3, 4, 5, 6, or 7 characters (Evidence: pg no: 7, L19)
7th character codes are invalid without the 7th character (Evidence: pg no: 8, L21-L22)
Indented format used for reference (Evidence: pg no: 8, L23)

detailed_rules.rule_text: All categories are 3 characters (Evidence: pg no: 7, L19)
detailed_rules.explanation: Every ICD-10-CM category consists of exactly three characters, which may be letters or numbers (Evidence: pg no: 7, L18-L19)

detailed_rules.rule_text: A code that has an applicable 7th character is considered invalid without the 7th character (Evidence: pg no: 8, L21-L22)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a code requires a 7th character, it must be included for the code to be valid and complete (Evidence: pg no: 8, L21-L22)

detailed_rules.rule_text: The final level of subdivision is a code (Evidence: pg no: 7, L20)
detailed_rules.explanation: Codes represent the most specific level of detail available in the classification system (Evidence: pg no: 7, L20)

workflow_steps: Step 2: Determine if subcategories (4-5 characters) exist
Step 3: Find the most specific code available
Step 4: Check if 7th character is required

code_patterns.explanation: Subcategories add one character to the category

code_categories_mentioned: All ICD-10-CM categories, subcategories, and codes

coding_scenarios.scenario: Determining proper code structure for a fracture
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Closed fracture of shaft of right femur, initial encounter
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify category S72 (fractures of femur)
Step 2: Find subcategory S72.3 (fracture of shaft of femur)
Step 3: Locate specific code S72.301 (unspecified fracture of shaft of right femur)
Step 4: Apply 7th character 'A' for initial encounter

correct_coding.rationale: 7th character is required for fracture codes and makes the code valid (Evidence: pg no: 8, L21-L22)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Missing required 7th character makes code invalid

breakdown.S72: 3-character category (fractures of femur) (Evidence: pg no: 7, L19)
breakdown.S72.3: 4-character subcategory (fracture of shaft of femur) (Evidence: pg no: 7, L19)
breakdown.S72.301: 6-character code (unspecified fracture of shaft of right femur) (Evidence: pg no: 7, L19)

examples.rationale: Demonstrates the hierarchical structure from category to final code with 7th character (Evidence: pg no: 7-8, L18-L22)

warnings: Codes with applicable 7th characters are invalid without them (Evidence: pg no: 8, L21-L22)
Must use most specific code available (Evidence: pg no: 7, L20)
best_practices: Use indented format to understand code hierarchy
Verify character count matches code requirements
common_mistakes: Not using most specific code available
tips: Remember that 7th character codes are still called codes, not subcategories
Use indented format to navigate code hierarchy
implementation_notes: Character validation is essential for code accuracy
clinical_context: Code structure reflects clinical specificity requirements
